abstract: Enviromental Protection Agency comes under attack from both parties in election year, with Democrats questioning agency's handing of Flint water crisis, and Republicans threatening to reduce its powers to almost nothing; EPA is responsible for enforcing regulations on business and agriculture, but shrinking budgets from hostile congress hamper their ability to do so.

headline.print_headline: E.P.A. Faces More Tasks, Louder Critics and a Shrinking Budget
headline.main: E.P.A. Faces Bigger Tasks, Smaller Budgets and Louder Critics

snippet: Under attack by both parties, the agency is facing a tumultuous election year, with more work, fewer resources and its very existence at stake.
lead_paragraph: Under attack by both parties, the agency is facing a tumultuous election year, with more work, fewer resources and its very existence at stake.
